intro: Mitrasacme paradoxa f. elata, commonly known as the slender mitrasacme, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant features elongated, slender stems and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
